title: 105_hr480
content: Increased disclosure of dues of tax-exempt organizations used for political purposes. The amendment to Section 6033(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 replaces the exception where dues are generally nondeductible. It states that organizations can be exempt from certain requirements if at least 90% of annual dues are from individuals paying $100 or less, or from other tax-exempt organizations. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years beginning after 1997 increases the $100 amount under subparagraph (A)(i) in Section 6033(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Organizations exempt from certain requirements include those with at least 90% of annual dues from individuals paying $100 or less, or from other tax-exempt organizations. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years beginning after 1997 increases the $100 amount under Section 6033(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment in Section 6033(e)(2)(A) prohibits the use of proxy tax to avoid disclosure to members. The organization may elect to pay a tax based on actual amounts rather than estimates under section 162(e)(1) for providing notices in a taxable year. The organization can elect to pay a tax based on actual amounts instead of estimates under section 162(e)(1) for providing notices in a taxable year. If the organization pays the tax, certain deductions for dues or similar amounts paid by a taxpayer to the organization will not apply. An additional tax may be imposed if incorrect notices are issued after the election. An additional tax may be imposed if estimates in notices are less than actual amounts, based on the highest tax rate for the year. This applies to failures to include amounts in notices or electing to pay based on actual amounts. The notice requirement under Section 6033(e)(1)(A)(ii) of the Code is amended to provide a reasonable estimate of the portion of dues or similar amounts to which expenditures are allocable at the time of payment. The notice requirement under Section 6033(e)(1)(A)(ii) of the Code is amended to provide a reasonable estimate of the portion of dues or similar amounts to which expenditures are allocable at the time of payment. Penalties for failure to provide notice include amendments to Section 6710 of the Code. The IRS Code is being amended to include a new subparagraph related to payee statements. Section 6033(e)(2)(B) is also being amended to update a reference. These changes are part of conforming amendments to the Code. The IRS Code is being amended to include a new subparagraph related to payee statements and update a reference in Section 6033(e)(2)(B). This is part of conforming amendments to the Code. Section 6710 is also amended to include that dues for lobbying activities are nondeductible. Organizations described in specific sections of 501(c) are subject to disclosure rules. The amendments made by this section apply to amounts paid or incurred after December 31, 1996. SEC. 2. 2-PERCENT FLOOR ON ITEMIZED DEDUCTIONS NOT TO APPLY TO DEDUCTION FOR DUES. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a deduction for dues paid to certain tax-exempt organizations. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 1996.
